page.title: 15HOUSTON HOUSE HOTEL
page.content: Houston House is a 16th century mansion and is situated in Uphall near Broxburn. It is used by its present owners as a hotel. Originally the land was owned by Hughston of Strathbrock and was passed to many people until in 1526 Sir James Hamilton of Fynart built a mansion on the land. This was called after its first owner but it was changed and instead of 'Hughston' it became known as 'Houston' House and it has stayed like that to this day. Inside, the house is beautifully decorated with angels and monsters carved into the ceiling and walls. The bedrooms have four-poster beds and the furnishings are bright and colourful. Many people visit the house and the large garden behind it which is full of flowers, adding to the beauty of Houston House.
